references.paper_title: High-resolution image synthesis with latent diffusion models
references.reason: This paper introduces a method for high-resolution image synthesis using latent diffusion models, which is a foundational technique leveraged in the TripoSG model for 3D shape generation.
This paper introduces the Objaverse-XL dataset, a large-scale collection of high-quality 3D models, which serves as the primary dataset used in training the TripoSG model.

references.paper_title: 3DShape2VecSet: A 3D Shape Representation for Neural Fields and Generative Diffusion Models
references.reason: This paper introduces the 3DShape2VecSet model, which is a key architectural component of the TripoSG model, leveraging the combination of transformer-based VAEs and rectified flow transformers.

references.paper_title: Flow straight and fast: Learning to generate and transfer data with rectified flow
references.reason: This paper introduces the rectified flow model, an important architectural component of the TripoSG model that enhances training stability and convergence in high-dimensional 3D shape generation.
This paper introduces a scalable transformer-based architecture for diffusion models, which is used in TripoSG to build a highly efficient and scalable 3D shape generation model.
